Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: twebst
Reviews.Content: I opted to stay here based on my first NH stay in Lyon. The hotel was modern looking and clean. The staff was extremely courteous, friendly and effficient. I had two meals and both were correct and priced well for a hotel. The location was very convenient and there is easy access (walking) to a vast amount of excvellent restaurants and bars. Negatives: As mentioned before, the availability of wi-fi. Too expensive in this day and age. Also, the "wood" flooring in my room was peeling. I am not sure how old the hotel is, but that was not right. I did have some problems with the television, but it was fixed immediately. All-in-all it was a good value for a business hotel in an upscale area

Reviews.Title: “upscale rooms”
Reviews.Author: hseofbel
Reviews.Content: I had the need to stay one night in this hotel. Though very new and modern rooms. Service left me taken aback....Breakfast was completely cold...I spoke with management and they quickly removed the charge from my bill....Would I stay there again...perhaps in a pinch, yes.

Reviews.Title: “Should be a good hotel but has too many limits!”
Reviews.Author: Luca M
Reviews.Content: NH Should be a good hotel but has too many limits! Let's start from wi-fi: you need to pay for it and you can only log one device (and nobody tells you this). Do you want to LG another device (even not at the same time)? Desk told me to buy another card! Of course I worked around (bridging). Breakfart area is a construction area with too few seats. Reception is not so welcoming and they are not proficient in English. Room are cold and noisy. Bathroom is not properly clean. If you want to have a design room, then you need to keep it shining..

Reviews.Title: “excellent mid-range business hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelduesouth
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for almost a week this month and have to say I am not generally a fan of nH hotels but this one was good. Modern, spacious very comfortable beds. Excellent location for business with an excellent formal dining tavern style on-hotel and a casual tavern type place full of locals just a few steps away. Santa Fe area is not good for a sightseeing/touristic stay in Mexico City. Plus the hotel has no pool... the only real downside even for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for business travellers to Mexico, Santa Fe business district”
Reviews.Author: reissu-erkki01
Reviews.Content: I would say in general very nice , modern hotel. Rooms spacy and 'chic'. Hotel personel very helpful, but english speaking could have been better. Breakfast included, OK. Location good for business travellers to Santa Fe business area. Close to the (expensive) shopping mall. Walls between the rooms are very thin and you hear everything thru the walls. When I was visiting the hotel it was quite empty and I did not have close room neighbours. Laminat floor is cold for barefoot.

Reviews.Title: “Light Sleepers Beware”
Reviews.Author: Hexte
Reviews.Content: Ultra modern and sleek hotel; but walls ultra-thin. If you are a light sleeper avoid this hotel at all costs. Guy next door on his Sprint/Nextel 2 way and cell phone until midnight; only to be awakened by the guest upstairs shower and playing of the television at 4 am. Oh, and cell phone guy begins whistling and talking on the telephone at 6 am. Floors are of wood and extremely cold; no amenities left by staff in the room. Positives: bed comfortable and flat panel screen on the wall.
